text: Bloody Mary is an electropop song by American recording artist Lady Gaga, released in December 2022 and recorded in 2010. It is from her second studio album, Born This Way (2011). The song's lyrics talk about Gaga assumes the role of biblical figure, Mary Magdalene, in who she found a "feminine force" in and worshipped her since her childhood in a Catholic girl school.https://twitter.com/ladygaga/status/73954379228647425 It is one of the several tracks on the album that have biblical references. In 2022, following the release of the Netflix horror-comedy series Wednesday, dances featuring the title character, Wednesday Addams, along with fan reactions, went viral on the video streaming service TikTok. Many used a sped-up version of the song. This resulted in a large increase of plays of this song on Spotify. == Charts == ===Weekly charts=== Chart performance for "Bloody Mary" Chart (2022â€“23) Peak position Bulgaria 33 Ireland (IRMA) 80 UK Singles (OCC) 22 US Billboard Hot 100 41 US Mainstream Top 40 (Billboard) 10 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (2023) Rank US Billboard Hot 100 99 US Radio Songs (Billboard) 47 US Mainstream Top 40 (Billboard) 35 US Adult Contemporary (Billboard) 47 US Adult Top 40 (Billboard) 22 ==References== Category:2011 songs Category:2022 songs Category:Lady Gaga songs
title: Bloody Mary (song)
